benchmark_details.name: MetaWild: A Multimodal Dataset for Animal Re-Identification with Environmental Metadata
benchmark_details.overview: MetaWild is a multimodal dataset designed to enable systematic evaluation of metadata integration and multimodal learning in Animal ReID. It pairs images with environmental metadata to enhance animal re-identification performance.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the impact of environmental metadata on Animal ReID performance and facilitate the development of multimodal ReID methods based on Vision-Language Models.

data.annotation: Identity annotations were independently verified by at least three annotators.

methods: Testing with and without environmental metadata
methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated using standard identity classification and triplet loss functions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher mAP and CMC-1 scores indicate better performance in correctly re-identifying animals.
methodology.validation: Validation through comparison of models using visual data only versus combined visual and metadata.
